nodes.bodyText: Forget if we have a ThreadLocal StringBuilder buffer, it would probably help here. But can do it later if we don't have it conveniently available.
if we bound it I suppose we could? This is currently only used in logging and I'm not sure if we want to leave a stringbuilder on each thread just in case toString is called...
in a reporter totally agree (as the reporter thread is likely only 1 or few)
by logging I mean if no-one sets a handler or a spanReporter
Should be a pretty simple win to accept StringBuilder as argument here instead of allocating inside.
